Review Text: A pitiful excuse for a plot....Not a fan of fat Amy in the first place and this just reinforced my opinion.  Normally love Goldie.....she must of had a senior moment to agree to this mess! No plot, or a rehash of a few adventures from long ago whichever it is DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!
Review Title: Terrible Start To Finish

Product Title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
Review Date: 2018/05/10
Store: Frances McDormand  (Actor),     Woody Harrelson  (Actor),     Martin McDonagh  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Fully Loaded DVDs, DTS
Product Description: ['Furious with the local authorities\' inability to name a suspect in the brutal murder of her teenage daughter, flinty divorced mom Mildred Hayes (Oscar-winner Frances McDormand) took out the titular signage to publicly challenge the competency of ailing sheriff Bill Willoughby (Woody Harrelson). As the controversy splits the small community, rising tempers cause the case to take even more bizarre and unexpected turns. Darkly comic thriller from director Martin McDonagh also stars Sam Rockwell, John Hawkes, Peter Dinklage. 115 min. Widescreen; Soundtracks: English Dolby Digital 5.1, DVS 5.1, Spanish Dolby Digital Surround, French Dolby Digital Surround; Subtitles: English (SDH), Spanish, French; bonus short "Six Shooter" (2004).']
Average Rating: 4.7

Product Description: ['Product Description', "Based on the New York Times bestseller, WONDER tells the story of August Pullman. raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The purchasing patterns reveal a consumer who tends toward emotionally resonant narratives, as indicated by high ratings for heartwarming stories and strong character-driven plots, reflecting a preference for engaging, thoughtful films. However, sentiment analysis indicates significant disappointment with poorly executed storylines, as evidenced by low ratings for films perceived as lacking depth or originality. Themes such as family dynamics, personal struggles, and social commentary recur frequently in their choices.

Quality preferences lean towards high-production-value content, including well-known directors and actors, which suggests a tendency to favor reputable cinematic works. At the same time, the consumer exhibits sensitivity to narrative construction, favoring stories that avoid clichés and that provide rewarding or uplifting experiences.

Price sensitivity is not explicitly discernible from the available data, but the consumer appears willing to invest in films that promise quality and emotional depth while being critical of those that do not meet these expectations. Overall, this individual prioritizes compelling storytelling and strong emotional arcs, demonstrating a clear aversion to mediocrity in film, while also recognizing and appreciating the occasional value in mainstream successes.

target_interaction.title: Slooowwww shipping for an OK movie
target_interaction.text: Movie has a great cast however, the storyline (IMHO) was just slightly above average. No southern grandmother I ever knew or heard of, talked like a sailor and aired personal business in a public forum!  The outcome is evident from the beginning however, there were some laughs to be had!
description: Julia Stiles (MONA LISA SMILE) and Academy Award(R) winner Shirley MacLaine (1983 Best Actress, TERMS OF ENDEARMENT) star in CAROLINA, the endearing romantic comedy about a young woman (Stiles) trying to escape the eccentric ways of her wacky Southern family and meet the man of her dreams -- a nice, normal available guy. Finding him appears easier said than done until she meets a handsome and debonair Englishman. Will Carolina's dream turn into a nightmare when she introduces her perfect guy to her less-than-perfect family? And what will her best friend Albert have to say? As funny and charming as SWEET HOME ALABAMA, this Southern belle is sure to sweep you off your ever-loving feet.
